data.question: What is the main focus of the research article?
data.answer: Direct observation of ammonia storage in UiO-66 incorporating Cu(II) binding sites

data.question: Which material showed the highest ammonia uptake at 273K and 1 bar?
Is the ammonia adsorption in UiO-66-CuII reversible?
What technique was used to investigate the local environment of Cu(II) in UiO-66-CuII?
Did UiO-66-CuI show higher ammonia adsorption capacity compared to UiO-66-defect?
What was the purpose of using HYSCORE spectroscopy in the study?
data.answer: To investigate the local environment of Cu(II) in UiO-66-CuII

data.question: Which material was reduced in a tube furnace with 5% H2 flow to obtain its reduced form?
data.answer: UiO-66-CuII was reduced to obtain UiO-66-CuI

data.question: Is the ammonia adsorption capacity of UiO-66-CuII at 273K and 1 bar higher than 15 mmol/g?
What was the loading of Cu in UiO-66-CuII as determined by ICP-OES?
Did the study find that the ammonia adsorption in UiO-66-CuII is accompanied by a reversible change in the coordination geometry of Cu(II)?
What was the dynamic uptake of ammonia in UiO-66-CuII at 298K and 630 ppm concentration?
Was the ammonia adsorption capacity of UiO-66-CuI at 273K and 1 bar above 10 mmol/g?
What method was used to synthesize UiO-66-defect?
data.answer: Terephthalic acid and zirconium tetrachloride were dissolved in a mixture of DMF and formic acid, transferred into a teflon lined bomb, sealed, and heated at 120 Â°C for 24 h

data.question: Did the study use in situ infrared spectroscopy to investigate interactions of NH3 in the porous materials?
What was the effect of ammonia adsorption on the BET surface area of UiO-66-defect?
data.answer: The BET surface area decreased after ammonia adsorption

data.question: Was the ammonia adsorption capacity of UiO-66-CuII compared with other MOF materials in the study?
What was the role of CuCl2 in the synthesis of UiO-66-CuII?
data.answer: CuCl2 was used to decorate UiO-66-defect with Cu(II) sites

data.question: Did the study find that UiO-66-CuII has a higher ammonia uptake capacity than UiO-66-CuI?
What was the main method used to characterize the synthesized materials?
Was the ammonia adsorption in UiO-66-CuII found to be highly reversible?
